title: Losing Control: It's About Anger, Frustration, and Violence
itunes:author: UW-Green Bay Psychology Department
itunes:summary: Episode three in this special series is on Mob Violence.  Ryan and Chuck start off this episode from the Weidner Center for the Performing Arts at UW-Green Bay with a LIVE segment about “mob violence,” then we hear from Dr. Kate Burns, a Psychology professor at UW-Green Bay, as she takes us through the psychology of groups. We finish this episode with an interview on mob violence with Dr. Lori H. Rosenthal, Associate Dean for the School of Humanities, Education, Justice, and Social Sciences, for Lasell College where she is also an Associate Professor of Psychology.
itunes:subtitle: Episode three in this special series is on Mob Vi…
description: Episode three in this special series is on Mob Violence.  Ryan and Chuck start off this episode from the Weidner Center for the Performing Arts at UW-Green Bay with a LIVE segment about “mob violence,” then we hear from Dr. Kate Burns, a Psychology professor at UW-Green Bay, as she takes us through the psychology of groups. We finish this episode with an interview on mob violence with Dr. Lori H. Rosenthal, Associate Dean for the School of Humanities, Education, Justice, and Social Sciences, for Lasell College where she is also an Associate Professor of Psychology.
